intro: Ligusticum scothicum subsp. scothicum, commonly known as the Scottish lovage, is a perennial herb native to the British Isles. It belongs to the family Apiaceae, which includes many aromatic and medicinal plants. The plant features finely divided, fern-like leaves and produces small, yellowish-green flowers in umbels. It thrives in moist, calcareous soils and is often found in woodland edges and stream banks. Its aromatic properties have led to its historical use in herbal medicine.
